00032 #define SIS3600_MAX_DMA_SIZE        256
00033 #define SIS3600_MAX_SIZE            (32*1024*4)
00034 #define ACTIVE_READOUT_BUFFER_SIZE  (32*1024*4)
00035 #define ACTIVE_READOUT_MAX_PER_POLL (2*1024)
00036 
00037 struct sis3600 {
00038   bool enabled;
00039   bool do_active_readout;
00040   struct vme_handle *vme_handle;
00041   unsigned long vme_base;
00042   char odb_name[20];
00043   char bank_name[20];
00044   int active_readout_size;
00045   unsigned char active_readout_buffer[ACTIVE_READOUT_BUFFER_SIZE];
00046 };

00048 #define MAX_SIS3600 4
00049 struct sis3600 sis3600[MAX_SIS3600];
00050 
00051 #define SIS3600_CSR           0x000
00052 #define SIS3600_KA_CLEAR      0x020
00053 #define SIS3600_KA_ENABLENEXT 0x028
00054 #define SIS3600_KA_RESET      0x060
00055 #define SIS3600_OUTBUF        0x100
00056 
00057 #define SIS3600_CSR_FIFO_EMPTY_MASK        0x00000100
00058 #define SIS3600_CSR_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_MASK 0x00000200
00059 
00060 /*
00061  * sis3600_bor1
00062  *
00063  * Initialize one SIS3600 module.
00064  */
00065 INT sis3600_bor1(struct sis3600 *sis)
00066 {
00067   // Get the VME base address of the module
00068   sis->vme_base = odb_get_dword("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/%s/vme address", 
00069                     crate_number, sis->odb_name);
00070 
00071   // Open a VME handle for memory-mapped access
00072   struct vme_mapping_ctrl mapping = { 
00073           VMEMAP_DWIDTH_32, 
00074           VMEMAP_ASPACE_A32, 
00075           VMEMAP_SUPUSERAM_SUPER, 
00076           VMEMAP_PRGDATAAM_DATA 
00077   };
00078 
00079   struct vme_handle *handle = 
00080           vme_open(sis->vme_base, mapping, 0x200, SIS3600_MAX_DMA_SIZE);
00081   sis->vme_handle = handle;
00082 
00083   // Reset
00084   vme_write_d32(handle, sis->vme_base | SIS3600_KA_RESET, 0x1);
00085 
00086   // Clear for the next block
00087   sis->active_readout_size = 0;
00088 
00089   // Read back current status register and check it
00090   DWORD csr = vme_read_d32(handle, sis->vme_base | SIS3600_CSR);
00091   if(csr != 0x00000300) {
00092     diag_print(0, "Unexpected status 0x%08x on %s after reset, disabling\n", 
00093       csr, sis->odb_name);
00094     sis->enabled = false;
00095     return FE_ERR_HW;
00096   }
00097 
00098   // Continue setup
00099   vme_write_d32(handle, sis->vme_base | SIS3600_CSR, 0x08010000);
00100   vme_write_d32(handle, sis->vme_base | SIS3600_KA_CLEAR, 0x1);
00101   vme_write_d32(handle, sis->vme_base | SIS3600_KA_ENABLENEXT, 0x1);
00102 
00103   // Again check the status register value
00104   csr = vme_read_d32(handle, sis->vme_base | SIS3600_CSR);
00105   if(csr != 0x00018300) {
00106     diag_print(0, "Unexpected status 0x%08x on %s after setup, disabling\n", 
00107       csr, sis->odb_name);
00108     sis->enabled = false;
00109     return FE_ERR_HW;
00110   }
00111 
00112   // Determine whether we're supposed to do active readout
00113   sis->do_active_readout =
00114     odb_get_bool("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/%s/Active Readout mode",
00115                     crate_number, sis->odb_name);
00116 
00117   return SUCCESS;
00118 }
00119 
00120 /*
00121  * sis3600_bor
00122  *
00123  * Called at the beginning of the run to discover SIS3600 modules
00124  * and initialize them.
00125  */
00126 INT sis3600_bor()
00127 {
00128   // Use the ODB to find any SIS3600 modules
00129   for(int j = 0; j < MAX_SIS3600; j++) {
00130 
00131     bool enabled = false;
00132 
00133     if (odb_find_key("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/COMP %d", crate_number, j)) {
00134       diag_print(1, "ODB says COMP %d is present, ", j);
00135       enabled = 
00136         odb_get_bool("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/COMP %d/enabled status", 
00137             crate_number, j);
00138       if (enabled) {
00139         diag_print(1, "and is enabled.  Initializing...\n");
00140       } else {
00141         diag_print(1, "but is disabled.\n");
00142       }
00143     }
00144 
00145     sis3600[j].enabled = enabled;
00146 
00147     // Set up the name of the MIDAS bank associated with the module
00148     sprintf(sis3600[j].bank_name, "CMP%d", j);
00149     sprintf(sis3600[j].odb_name, "COMP %d", j);
00150 
00151     if(enabled) {
00152       sis3600_bor1(&sis3600[j]);
00153     }
00154   }
00155 
00156   return SUCCESS;
00157 }
00158 
00159 INT sis3600_eor1(struct sis3600 *sis)
00160 {
00161   vme_close(sis->vme_handle);
00162   return SUCCESS;
00163 }
00164 
00165 /*
00166  * sis3600_eor
00167  *
00168  * Called at the end of the run to release any resources that may have
00169  * been allocated.
00170  */
00171 INT sis3600_eor()
00172 {
00173 
00174   for(int i = 0; i < MAX_SIS3600; i++) {
00175     if(sis3600[i].enabled) {
00176       int status = sis3600_eor1(&sis3600[i]);
00177       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00178          return status;
00179       }
00180     }
00181   }
00182 
00183   return SUCCESS;
00184 }
00185 
00186 INT sis3600_fifo_read(struct sis3600 *sis, unsigned char *buffer, 
00187                       int max_size, bool in_active_readout)
00188 {
00189   // If we're not in the active readout phase, then we simply do a big DMA.
00190   // There is a 50% chance of losing one word at the end of the block.
00191   if(!in_active_readout) {
00192     int status = vme_dma_read(sis->vme_handle,
00193                               sis->vme_base | SIS3600_OUTBUF, 
00194                               buffer,
00195                               max_size);
00196     return status;
00197   } 
00198 
00199   // If we are in the active readout phase, then we have to be more careful.
00200   // Before initiating a block transfer, we check whether the CSR 
00201   // indicates "almost empty."  If it does not, a 256 byte (64 word)
00202   // block transfer is safe.  If it does, then we return nothing; we'll 
00203   // be back when there is enough data to bother with.
00204   int size = 0;
00205   while(size < max_size) {
00206 
00207     DWORD csr = vme_read_d32(sis->vme_handle, sis->vme_base | SIS3600_CSR);
00208     if(csr & SIS3600_CSR_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_MASK) {
00209       return size;  
00210     }
00211 
00212     int size_this_time = MIN(max_size - size, 256);
00213 
00214     int status = vme_dma_read(sis->vme_handle,
00215                               sis->vme_base | SIS3600_OUTBUF, 
00216                               buffer + size,
00217                               size_this_time);
00218 
00219     if(status >= 0) {
00220       size += status;
00221     }
00222 
00223     if(status != size_this_time) {
00224       diag_print(0, "Retrieved only %d bytes from %s", status, sis->odb_name);
00225     }
00226   }
00227 
00228   return size;
00229 }
00230 
00231 /*
00232  * sis3600_poll1
00233  *
00234  * Performs active readout for a single SIS3600 FIFO.
00235  */
00236 INT sis3600_poll1(struct sis3600 *sis)
00237 {
00238   // If active readout is not enabled, skip it.
00239   if(!sis->do_active_readout) {
00240     return SUCCESS;
00241   }
00242 
00243   // First check how much space we have available in the active
00244   // readout buffer.
00245   int size_left = ACTIVE_READOUT_BUFFER_SIZE - sis->active_readout_size;
00246   int size = MIN(ACTIVE_READOUT_MAX_PER_POLL, size_left);
00247   
00248   // Now try to read up to that amount.
00249   int status = sis3600_fifo_read(sis, 
00250                       sis->active_readout_buffer + sis->active_readout_size,
00251                       size, TRUE);
00252                             
00253   // Check the status
00254   if(status >= 0) {
00255     sis->active_readout_size += status;
00256   } else {
00257     diag_print(0, "Status from sis3600_fifo_read is %d for %s.\n", status,
00258       sis->odb_name);
00259     return FE_ERR_HW;
00260   }
00261 
00262   if(sis->active_readout_size == ACTIVE_READOUT_BUFFER_SIZE) {
00263     return FE_NEED_STOP;
00264   } else {
00265     return SUCCESS;
00266   }
00267 }
00268 
00269 /*
00270  * sis3600_poll_live
00271  *
00272  * Called periodically while a block is active; performs active readout.
00273  *
00274  * Returns:
00275  * - ordinarily 0,
00276  * - a request for a "soft stop" end-of-block, or
00277  * - an error code
00278  */
00279 INT sis3600_poll_live()
00280 {
00281   for(int i = 0; i < MAX_SIS3600; i++) {
00282     if(sis3600[i].enabled) {
00283       int status = sis3600_poll1(&sis3600[i]);
00284       if(status != SUCCESS) {
00285         return status; 
00286       }
00287     }
00288   }
00289 
00290   return SUCCESS;
00291 }
00292 
00293 /*
00294  * sis3600_read1
00295  *
00296  * Constructs the MIDAS bank for a single SIS3600.
00297  */
00298 INT sis3600_read1(struct sis3600 *sis, char *pevent)
00299 {
00300   // Create the MIDAS bank
00301   DWORD *pdata;
00302   bk_create(pevent, sis->bank_name, TID_DWORD, &pdata);
00303 
00304   // Copy data that was read during the active readout
00305   int active_size = sis->active_readout_size;
00306   memcpy(pdata, sis->active_readout_buffer, active_size);
00307 
00308   // Read any data remaining in the module
00309   int status = 
00310     sis3600_fifo_read(sis,  ((unsigned char *) pdata) + active_size,
00311                       SIS3600_MAX_SIZE, FALSE);
00312   
00313   // Check the status
00314   int final_size = 0;
00315   if(status >= 0) {
00316     final_size = status;
00317   } else {
00318     // handle the error
00319   }
00320 
00321   // Close the bank
00322   bk_close(pevent, pdata + (active_size + final_size)/sizeof(DWORD));
00323 
00324   // Clear for the next block
00325   sis->active_readout_size = 0;
00326 
00327   // Clear FIFO
00328   vme_write_d32(sis->vme_handle, sis->vme_base | SIS3600_KA_CLEAR, 0x1);
00329 
00330   return SUCCESS;
00331 }
00332 
00333 /*
00334  * sis3600_read
00335  *
00336  * Called at the end of a block to assemble data from that block into a 
00337  * MIDAS event.
00338  */
00339 INT sis3600_read(char *pevent)
00340 {
00341   for(int i = 0; i < MAX_SIS3600; i++) {
00342     if(sis3600[i].enabled) {
00343       int status = sis3600_read1(&sis3600[i], pevent);
00344        if(status != SUCCESS) {
00345          return status;
00346        }
00347     }
00348   }
00349 
00350   return SUCCESS;
00351 }
